newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - November 18.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Tamil Tiger rebels attack bunker line in Poovarasankulam, Vavuniya killing four soldiers.
EPDP appeals to government to provide relief for 200,000 displaced people in Wanni after army offensives in northern Jaffna and Kilinochchi.
United States Ambassador Peter Burleigh says U.S. foreign policy gives high priority to control terrorism.
Navy intercepts Indian trawlers transporting Tamils to south India.
President Chandrika Kumaratunga says she came into politics do develop country and not hold on to power.
National Education Commission recommends immediate increase in Advanced Level examination qualifying marks to 200 from 180 for university entrance.
Labour Commissioner R. Wimalasena to chair tripartite talks on resolving strike at Shell Gas Lanka Ltd.
